availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Holland (Logan County, Kentucky, physician, 1st sgt & 2nd lieut 26th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. North Carolina native. Married to Sarah Holland. Father of Lacy Holland. Physician in Logan County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Logan County in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant and second lieutenant from March 17, 1862, to his resignation on January 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 468.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 33.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0378.
